page.title: 14Burnmouth Farm
page.content: It is known as{Burnmouth}because the Newtyle burn used to flow into a marshy loch at this farm. Mr.Lyburn is the tenant farmer. He buys in 63 cattle and sheep in October.He buys them at Perth and the sheep from the Borders.He grows{fodder {crops}like potatoes,turnips,hay,silage and barley to feed his animals in winter.They are kept indoors from November to the first week in May. He also grows spring barley, wheat, peas,carrots,beans and potatoes for sale.These are called{cash crops. He has 4 full time workers as it is a very big farm. He also has a lot of farm machinery. Mark Edward P.7.
